subject: Dead broadband sensor
description: All 3 channels of the broadband sensor at FSAH1 are not recording ground motions. We have approached Randy about this sensor but it is not resolved. This ticket remains open.

subject: Dead broadband sensor
description: Keeping this ticket open for a dead broadband sensor.

subject: Elevated noise on broadband
description: All 3 broadband channels exceeded the 'hiAmp' threshold. This issues has been corrected in our metadata inventory and will soon be installed. However, the ticket will remain open until the station passes thresholds. NOTE: the 'badresp' metric was used for the first time this week, and it succesfully flagged this station.

subject: Gaps
caption: Waveform showing typical gap pattern for CDF channels.;;;;Daily number of gaps for the ADKI.01 element. Pattern in similar for all elements.;;;;Number of gaps affects percent_availability for all elements.
description: All elements of the ADKI array exhibit large numbers of gaps in the CDF channels for the entire reporting period. Daily number of gaps appear to spike on 2020-11-20 and 2020-11-21. Note, combining the separate tickets for each element into this single ticket.

subject: Gaps
caption: Waveform at I53H1 showing pattern of gaps;;;;Daily percent_availability at I53H1 showing the effect of large gaps on data availability. There is a similar pattern for all I53 channels
description: There were a small number of large gaps for all channels of all elements of I53. 2020-11-19, 2020-11-21, 2020-11-22.

subject: Gaps
caption: Comparison of IRIS-downloaded vs WATC-downloaded waveforms for ELK.BHZ showing gaps in WATC data but not in IRIS;;;;Daily number of gaps on BHZ. Similar numbers for all components
description: All broadband channels at US.ELK exhibit high numbers of gaps for the entire reporting period. The same data from the IRIS FDSN do not exhibit gaps. There appears to be a communication error at some point. Gaps continuing through the current reporting period.

subject: Gaps and Outage
caption: ;;;;Plots of daily percent_availability showing outage at H1, H2, and H3 on 2020-11-21;;;;;;;;;;;;
description: Elements 1, 2, and 3 continue to experience gaps and intermittent outages for this period, so this ticket will remain open. Note that the 3 tickets for each element have been combined into this single ticket.  There were gaps and a significant outage on 2020-11-21.

subject: Large gaps
caption: Waveform showing gap pattern at I59H1. There is a similar pattern at the other elements;;;;Daily percent_availability showing the effect of large gaps on data availability at I59
description: There were large gaps at all elements of I59 during the reporting period. The lowest availability occurred on 2020-11-21 and 2020-11-22

subject: Low Data Availability
caption: Waveforms showing large gaps in the SJG broadband for the week
description: There was low data availability for all 3 channels of the SJG braodband for the entire reporting period.

subject: Malfunctioning weather station at FSAH2.M1
caption: Waveform showing digitizer noise from the met channels
description: Continued dead channels for the met sensor at this station.

subject: Noise on Broadband
caption: PDF plot for vertical broadband showing mass recenter;;;;;;;;
description: Re-opening this ticket as the 'hiAmp' threshold was exceeded on 2020-11-15. While there continues to be elevated mid-period noise, threshold exceedance usually seems to be associated with mass recenters. There has been once a week for the last 2 weeks. I'll keep this ticket open and keep an eye on the mrcs going forward. Closing this ticket as noise thresholds were not exceeded for this reporting period.

subject: Noise on Infrasound, Gaps and outages
caption: Elevated noise - possible wind event;;;;Station was below noise thresholds on this day
description: All elements were out on 2020-11-16 and 2020-11-17 and came back late on 2020-11-18. There was high noise on elements I4-I6 om 2020-11-19 and 2020-11-21. The noise spectra did not exceed the hiAmp threshold on 2020-11-20. It is likely that these are just wind-induced transient noise events. The ticket will remain open until this can be verified against wind data.

subject: Noise on PMSA broadband
caption: Waveforms from 3-component broadband showing transient noise;;;;Clear mass-recenter signature on vertical channel;;;;Mass re-center and calibrations;;;;Calibrations on BH2 channel
description: There were transient noise events on all 3 braodband channels on 2020-11-17 and 2020-11-18 that appear to be associated with calibrations and mass recenters. Also, elevated mid-period noise was evident for the rest of the reporting period. Although the worst noise appears to be transient, this ticket will remain open as we monitor noise characteristics.

subject: Outage
caption: Waveform at I1 showing extent of the outage at FSAH3
description: All channels of all elements of FSAH[3-8] experienced an outage from 2020-11-14 through 2020-11-17. Data came back late on 2020-11-18.

subject: Spikes and noise
caption: PDF plot showing high-frequency noise on the I4 infrasound element
description: Element 5 flagged for noise and spikes last reporting period and elements 4, 5, and 6 were also noisy this period. I am combing the 3 elements into the same In progress ticket. Infrasound spectral metrics are limited to a single day for the current period, but there will be more information available next week. Closing this ticket as noise threshold were not exceeded for the new reporting period.

subject: Noise characteristics at NVAR
caption: Daily percent above noise model at NV11.SHZ for the reporting period;;;;PDF plot showing elevated noise at NV11.SHZ;;;;;;;;
description: All short-periods seismometers of the NVAR array continue to exceed the 'hiAmp' threshold. Identified issues in our metadata. Ticket will remain open until these issues are addressed.
